title: [Feature Request] Nested credential inheritance for folders
author: BloodyIron
body_snippet:
I'm on v1.75.7012.16814

When I set a folder to inherit from a folder above it, that has login creds, the sub-folder does not seem to inherit the creds, and connections under the second folder do not seem to inherit the creds from the first folder.

Any chance we could get this feature added?

Or, I can't seem to find how this is done, as the normal inheritance method does not seem to do this.

iterations.description: Enhances credential management by allowing connections deeply nested in folder structures to inherit credentials from an ancestor folder, skipping intermediate folders that do not specify credentials.

- Folder1 (user/domain/password set)
    - Folder2  (inheritance set for user/domain/password)
         - Connection1 (inheritance set for user/domain/password)

Where folder2 and connection1 have inheritance set.

Could you provide an export of a small section of your connection file? Be sure to change the names of hosts/usernames/passwords/domains. I really just need to see the general setup of the folders and the connection that isn't taking the credentials correctly...

comments.author: SanderGit
comments.snippet:
@sparerd We use a SQL server database to share the connections across engineers. I'd like this feature, but the credentials should not be shared i.e. not saved in the public database. 
We cannot accomplish this with the default SSO/default account settings in the application, because we have two Windows domains to work with, hence every engineer has two sets of credentials. These should ideally be set on the top folder level under which the servers for the given domain are listed.

comments.author: BloodyIron
comments.snippet:
@SanderGit perhaps break that out into another ticket? I do like the sound of that method though :D

Although, I would propose more flexibility in separating creds from connection info, as some of my situations there's many different creds to manage, and root creds wouldn't be flexible enough for me, but a central store of connection config info would be super rad!

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: @SanderGit That use case will be possible once #208 is implemented. There is also a change being tested in the next v1.76 minor release that will handle saving certain properties on a user's machine rather than in the database. We will be using that to save some flags on individual user machines, but it will also be used for saving credential/connection assignments.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Enhances credential management by allowing connections deeply nested in folder structures to inherit credentials from an ancestor folder, skipping intermediate folders that do not specify credentials.
Approach: Modify the credential resolution logic (likely in ConnectionInfo or a helper class handling inheritance) to traverse the parent hierarchy upwards until a non-empty credential is found, instead of checking only the immediate parent.
